main.name: Crispian Morris
main.description: I am a Computer Science PhD student at the University of Bristol, focusing on applications of machine learning to image processing
main.bio: I'm a PhD student with a 1st class degree in Engineering Mathematics and over two years of experience in industry. Highly organised, I efficiently manage my time autonomously whilst remaining an integral part of any team. Interested in developing computer technologies, and quickly adaptable to new approaches, I'm naturally creative in my approaches to problem solving. My research interests are mainly composed of combinations of computer vision and artificial intelligence.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: BBC/iCASE funded PhD looking at deep learning inspired computer vision approches for object detection in low-light videography.
1st Class Honours, with a focus on data science, artificial intelligence and machine learning.

work.title: Laptop and Mobile Clinic Supervisor
work.description: I work with and intermittently supervise a team of technicians to help University students troubleshoot issues on their personal devices. We deal with a variety of cases at varying levels of difficulty; from resolving incorrect network configuration to simply advising students about digital best practice. I was awarded the prestigious Outstanding PLUS award in the 'Everyday Hero' category for my efforts.

work.title: Engineering Assistant
work.description: I assisted the engineers at KVAL with intermediate CAD, organized several different file servers, and increased their overall productivity significantly. I completed several research projects on potential applications for new or developing technologies in our industry, and helped manage the github repositories associated with our various production flows.
